ose.name: Open Source Everything
ose.brief: A series of posters for the Open Source Everything manifesto, which calls for a society built upon truth, transparency, and trust. Access to information on the posters is actively obstructed through visual complexity and coded language. Each reflects one of the three main paradigms of computing: the mainframe, the cloud, and edge computing. Accompanying is a US English QWERTY keyboard cover screen printed with binary encoded characters. The piece contextualizes thought, input/output, and screens with the actual information stored on hard drives.

imgs.caption: A QWERTY keyboard cover that displays binary encoded values in place of alphabetical characters. Screen print on acrylic.

c3p.name: Close Third Person
c3p.scope: Identity, large format banner, large format posters, postcards, animated invitations
c3p.brief: An identity for the UConn 2018 Master of Fine Arts Exhibition. The sliding mark and overlapping graphics speak to shifting perspectives and proximities — a quiet, thoughtful dance that guided each graduate during their time at the University.

hyperreal.name: HYPERREAL
hyperreal.media: Print, web: Node.js + Nuxt.js + facial recognition + live streaming, digital animation, digital 3D, physical 3D
hyperreal.scope: Silkscreen posters, book, web application, typeface, animated posters, laser-cut acrylic
hyperreal.brief: HYPERREAL was an exhibition that addressed the duality of modern existence: physicality (real) and intangibility (hyperreal). Each component was meant to invoke questions as viewers experienced and interacted with them. HYPERREAL's intent was to illuminate aspects of our lives which are new, complex, and only partially understood, yet often overlooked and easily accepted.

imgs.caption: Posters made to exhibit the partial nature of physical reality and overlay of hyperreality through typography.
A box, whose contents were live-streamed to a display elsewhere in the space.
Posters on display at Central Saint Martins in London.
"whoami" is an imagined dialogue between a human having an existential crisis, and a machine with internet access.
The book questions what sort of existence is represented when a user is visually reduced to data.
Messages from tech tycoons are printed through out the book.
An series of exploratory kinetic posters, revealing interstitial moments of typography and meaning.

cor2e-symposium.name: COR²E Symposium
cor2e-symposium.scope: Identity, large format posters, postcards, animated invitations
cor2e-symposium.brief: The Center for Open Research Resources and Equipment at UConn held its first Symposium in November 2018. COR²E is composed of 9 applied science research facilities. At the symposium, directors and users gathered to discuss the services and equipment at each facility. Using COR²E's identity, the event's design and typography travel, converge, and undulate, as crowds do.

cor2e-facilities.name: COR²E Facilities
cor2e-facilities.brief: The Center for Open Research Resources and Equipment at UConn (COR²E) is composed of 9 applied science research facilities. Challanged to compose an identity system for each facililty, the sciences, methods, and tools that define each discipline were used to inform individual graphical systems that would compose a whole. The project was ultimately abandoned by UConn.

imgs.caption: Stylized type based on distribution graphs used in Flow Cytometry (FC) analyses of cells
Advanced Light Microscopy (ALM) image of 3D printed steel reflectance at 250 micron:1 inch scale
Manipulated ALM image of a privet leaf

lincus.name: Lincus
lincus.brief: A startup whose flagship product is a search engine for scientific research expertise. The identity was designed to reflect the idea of interconnection, while invoking a sense of community and intellectualism.

spect.name: spect
spect.media: Web based generative design tool, digital

groove.name: GROOVE Recording
groove.scope: Brand identity, website, t-shirts, business cards, letterhead, invoices, animated advertisements
groove.brief: GROOVE Recording is the recording practice of a seasoned drummer who brings years of performing experience to his studio. In order to stand out in a saturated, cut-and-dry market, the brand invokes rhythm and movement. The identity system is composed of a suite of grooves, inspired by rudiments and dances.
